docs.title: ✨ Why Document My Projects?
docs.text:
• Helps me track progress over time.
  • Improves clarity of thought while working through problems.
  • Records my mistakes and fixes, avoiding repetition.
  • Becomes a personal knowledge base and portfolio.
  • Useful for sharing with mentors, teammates, or job interviews.

docs.title: 🛠️ How I Plan to Document Everything
docs.text:
I’ll use Markdown (.md) for all documentation. Each project will have its own folder with the following files:

MyProject/
├── _start_.md               <- This file (how & why)
├── README.md                <- Summary of the project
├── 01_problem_statement.md  <- What's the problem?
├── 02_thinking_and_approach.md
├── 03_data_pipeline.md
├── 04_model_architecture.md
├── 05_training_logs.md
├── 06_issues_and_solutions.md
├── 07_results_and_visuals.md
├── 08_learnings.md
└── 09_future_work.md

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: 📘 Learn & Use MkDocs
docs.text:
Here’s a clean template you can copy-paste into your file:

# 📚 MkDocs: Project Documentation to Website

---

## 🧠 What is MkDocs?

**MkDocs** is a fast, static site generator that's perfect for creating **project documentation** using **Markdown** files.  
You write `.md` files, and MkDocs turns them into a searchable website.

---

## ⚙️ Step-by-Step: Getting Started

### 1️⃣ Install MkDocs

```bash
pip install mkdocs

To verify:

mkdocs --version

docs.title: 2️⃣ Create a New MkDocs Project
docs.text:
mkdocs new my-project-docs
cd my-project-docs

You'll see:

my-project-docs/
├── docs/
│   └── index.md
└── mkdocs.yml

docs.title: 3️⃣ Serve the Docs Locally
docs.text:
mkdocs serve

Then open http://127.0.0.1:8000 in your browser. You'll see your site live!

docs.title: ✏️ Add More Markdown Files
docs.text: Create more files like intro.md, usage.md, troubleshooting.md inside the docs/ folder.

docs.title: 🧭 Update mkdocs.yml Navigation
docs.text:
site_name: My Project Docs

nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - Introduction: intro.md
  - Usage: usage.md
  - Troubleshooting: troubleshooting.md

docs.title: Install Plugin:
docs.text:
pip install mkdocs-mermaid2-plugin

Update mkdocs.yml:

plugins:
  - search
  - mermaid2

Now use Mermaid in any .md file:


```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Start] --> B[Create Docs]
    B --> C[Serve]
    C --> D[Deploy]
```

docs.title: 🚀 Deploy to GitHub Pages
docs.text:
Make sure your project is a Git repo:

git init
git remote add origin <your-repo-url>

Deploy:

mkdocs gh-deploy

docs.title: 🖼️ How to Add Images in MkDocs
✅ Step 2: Use Markdown to Display Image
✨ Optional Enhancements (HTML)
docs.text:
Center + Resize Image:

<p align="center">
  <img src="assets/flowchart.png" alt="Flowchart" width="600"/>
</p>

Resize Only:

<img src="assets/flowchart.png" alt="Flowchart" width="500">

docs.title: 📌 Final Tips
docs.text:
• Keep all images inside docs/assets/
  • Use mkdocs serve to preview changes live
  • Use mkdocs-material theme for a clean, professional look
  • Maintain structure and version control using Git
